visualization_prompt: Create a Highcharts chartOptions object to render a line chart with the following specifications: Chart type: line, Chart title: Monthly Average Temperature, Axes and labels styling: Use a dark blue color (#003366) for the title and axis labels, with a font size of 14px. The x-axis categories should be the months of the year. Data series: The data series should represent the monthly average temperature for a year, with the data provided. Custom colors: Use a light yellow background for the plot area (#FCFFC5). Additional configurations: Set the chart margins to 50px on the top and bottom, and 100px on the left and right. Include a legend at the bottom of the chart.
visualization_explanation: The provided Highcharts chartOptions object is configured to render a line chart with a light yellow background for the plot area. The chart title is set to 'Monthly Average Temperature' with a dark blue color and a font size of 14px. The x-axis categories represent the months of the year, and the y-axis title is 'Temperature (°C)', both styled with the same dark blue color and font size. The data series represents the monthly average temperature for a year, with the provided data. The chart margins are set to 50px on the top and bottom, and 100px on the left and right. A legend is included at the bottom of the chart, centered and horizontally aligned.
